ﺮﺠﺤﻟﺍ ﺮﺼﻋ
ﻡﺍﺪﺨﺘﺳﺎﺑ ﺔﻳﺮﺠﺣ ﺕﺍﻭﺩﺃ ﻊﻨﺻﺍ ﺮﺠﺤﻟﺎﺑ ﺖﺤﻨﻟﺍ، ﺎﻀﻳﺃ ﺮﻈﻧﺍ .ﺄﺠﻠﻣ ﻲﻨﺑﺍﻭ ،ﻪﻨﻣ ﺪﻔﺘﺳﺍﻭ ﻡﺎﻌﻄﻟﺍ ﻊﻤﺟﺍ ،ﺭﺎﻨﻟﺍ ﻊﻨﺻﺍ: ﻦﻴﺋﺪﺘﺒﻤﻠﻟ ﺀﺎﻘﺒﻟﺍ ﻞﻴﻟﺩ.

ﻑﺰﺨﻟﺍ ﺮﺼﻋ
ﻑﺮﺘﺣﺍﻭ ﻢﻠﻌﺗ ﻑﺰﺨﻟﺍ ﻦﻓ. ﺾﻌﺑ ﺝﺮﺨﺘﺳﺍﻭ ﻦﻋ ﺚﺤﺑﺍ ﻦﻴﻄﻟﺍ. ﺔﻴﻨﻴﻃ ﺔﻴﻋﻭﺃ ﻚﺴﻔﻨﻟ ﻊﻨﺻﺍ ﻦﻳﺰﺨﺘﻠﻟ، ﺭﻭﺪﻗ ﻭﻕﺎﺒﻃﺃ ﻚﻟﺬﻛﻭ ،ﺕﺎﺒﺟﻮﻟﺍ ﻝﻭﺎﻨﺗﻭ ﻲﻬﻄﻟ ﺔﻘﺗﻮﺑ ﻭﺕﺍﻭﺩﻷﺍ ﺐﻟﺍﻮﻗ ﺀﺪﺒﻟ ﺪﻴﺟ ﺖﻗﻭ ﺎﻀﻳﺃ ﺍﺬﻫ .ﺱﺎﺤﻨﻟﺍ ﺮﺼﻌﻟ ﺩﺍﺪﻌﺘﺳﻼﻟ ﺔﻋﺍﺭﺰﻟﺍ.
ﺔﻴﺒﺸﺧ ﻉﻭﺭﺩ ﺔﻋﻮﻤﺠﻣ ﺭﻼﻴﻣﻻ (ﺱﺃﺭ، ﻢـﺴﺟ، ﻥﺎـﻗﺎﺳ) ﻭﺃ .ﺾﻔﺨﻨﻤﻟﺍ ﻯﻮﺘﺴﻤﻟﺍ ﻦﻣ ﺀﺍﺪﻋﻷﺍ ﺪﺿ ﺔﻴﻓﺎﺿﺇ ﺔﻳﺎﻤﺣ ﺮﻓﻮﺗ ﺔﻨﻄﺒﻤﻟﺍ ﻉﻭﺭﺪﻟﺍ ﻥﺎﺘﻜﻟﺍ ﻦﻣ ﺮﻴﺜﻜﻟﺍ ﻚﻳﺪﻟ ﻥﺎﻛ ﺍﺫﺇ ﺓﺯﺎﺘﻤﻣ.

ﺱﺎﺤﻨﻟﺍ ﺮﺼﻋ ﺕﺎﻳﺍﺪﺑ
40 ﻦﻋ ﺚﺤﺑﺍ .ﻪﻗﺮﺣﺃﻭ ﻦﻴﻄﻟﺍ ﻡﺍﺪﺨﺘﺳﺎﺑ ﺔﻗﺮﻄﻣﻭ ﻞﺠﻨﻣ ﺐﻟﺎﻗ ﻊﻨﺻﺍ !ﻲﺳﺎﺤﻧ ﻞﺠﻨﻣﻭ ﺔﻗﺮﻄﻣ ﻊﻨﺼﻟ ﺖﻗﻮﻟﺍ ﻥﺎﺣ ﻡﺎﺨﻟﺍ ﺱﺎﺤﻨﻟﺍ ﻦﻣ ﺔﻌﻄﻗ. ﺎﻬﻴﻠﻋ ﺭﻮﺜﻌﻟﺍ ﻚﻨﻜﻤﻳ ﺓﺮﺛﺎﻨﺘﻣ ﻲﻓ ﺎﻬﻴﻠﻋ ﺭﻮﺜﻌﻟﺍ ﺎﻀﻳﺃ ﻚﻨﻜﻤﻳ .ﺽﺭﻷﺍ ﺖﺤﺗ ﺐﺳﺍﻭﺭ ﺩﻮﺟﻭ ﻰﻟﺇ ﺎﻀﻳﺃ ﺮﻴﺸﻳ ﺎﻤﻣ ،ﺽﺭﻷﺍ ﻰﻠﻋ ﺓﺭﻮﺴﻜﻤﻟﺍ ﻲﻧﺍﻭﻷﺍ، ﻝﻼﺧ ﻦﻣ ﻭﺃ ﻰﺼﺤﻟﺍﻭ ﻞﻣﺮﻟﺍ ﺔﻠﺑﺮﻏ، ﻰﻠﻋ ﻞﺼﺣﺍ .ﺭﺎﺠﺘﻟﺍ ﻦﻣ ﺎﻫﺅﺍﺮﺷ ﻭﺃ ﻱﺮﺠﺣ ﻢﺤﻓ ﺎﻀﻳﺃ ﺮﻈﻧﺍ .ﺭﺎﻨﻟﺍ ﺓﺮﻔﺣ ﻰﻠﻋ ﺱﺎﺤﻨﻟﺍ ﺮﻬﺻﻭ: ﺮﻬﺼﻟﺍ ﻞﻴﻟﺩ. ﻊﻣﻼﻟﺍ ﺪﻳﺪﺠﻟﺍ ﺱﺎﺤﻨﻟﺍ ﻞﺠﻨﻣ ﻡﺍﺪﺨﺘﺳﺎﺑ ﻪﻌﻤﺟ ﻚﻨﻜﻤﻳ ﻱﺬﻟﺍﻭ ،ﺱﺎﺤﻨﻟﺍ ﻡﺎﺧ ﻖﺤﺳ ﺔﻗﺮﻄﻤﻟﺍ ﻚﻟ ﺢﻴﺘﺗ .ﻞﺠﻨﻤﻟﺍﻭ ﺔﻗﺮﻄﻤﻟﺍ ﺐﻟﺎﻗ ﻲﻓ ﺭﻮﻬﺼﻤﻟﺍ ﺱﺎﺤﻨﻟﺍ ﺐﻜﺳﺍ.

ﺱﺎﺤﻨﻟﺍ ﺮﺼﻋ ﺕﺎﻳﺎﻬﻧ
ﺐﻟﺎﻗ ﻊﻨﺻﺍﻭ ﺱﺎﺤﻨﻟﺍ ﺐﺳﺍﻭﺭ ﻦﻣ ﻲﻔﻜﻳ ﺎﻣ ﺝﺮﺨﺘﺳﺍ ﻥﺍﺪﻨﺳ. ﻞﺜﻣ ﺔﻘﻴﻗﺩ ﺕﺍﻭﺩﺃ ﻊﻨﺻ ﻦﻣ ﻦﻜﻤﺘﺘﺳ ،ﻥﺍﺪﻨﺴﻟﺍ ﺮﻬﺼﺗ ﻥﺃ ﺩﺮﺠﻤﺑ ﺭﺎﺸﻨﻣ، ﺔﻴﺒﺸﺧ ﺡﺍﻮﻟﺃ ﻊﻴﻨﺼﺗ ﻚﻟ ﺢﻴﺘﻳ ﺎﻤﻣ.
ﻊﻨﺻ ،ﻯﺮﺧﺃ ﺭﻮﻣﺃ ﻦﻴﺑ ﻦﻣ ،ﻚﻨﻜﻤﻳ ،ﺔﻴﺒﺸﺨﻟﺍ ﺡﺍﻮﻟﻷﺍ ﻡﺍﺪﺨﺘﺳﺎﺑ ﻉﻭﺭﺩ ﺝﺎﺘﻧﺇﻭ ﺕﺍﻭﺮﻀﺨﻟﺍ ﻆﻔﺣ ﻚﻟ ﺢﻴﺘﺗ ﻲﺘﻟﺍﻭ ،ﻞﻴﻣﺍﺮﺑﻭ ﺪﻠﺟ ﺔﻳﺪﻠﺟ ﻉﻭﺭﺩ ﺔﻋﺎﻨﺼﻟ ﺭﻼﻴﻣﻻ.

ﺰﻧﻭﺮﺒﻟﺍ ﺮﺼﻋ
ﺔﺛﻼﺜﻟﺍ ﺰﻧﻭﺮﺒﻟﺍ ﻉﺍﻮﻧﺃ ﺪﺣﺃ ﻰﻠﻋ ﻞﺼﺣﺍ:
- ﺮﻳﺪﺼﻘﻟﺍ ﺰﻧﻭﺮﺑ: ﺱﺎﺤﻨﻟﺎﺑ ﻪﻄﻠﺧﺍﻭ ﺮﻳﺪﺼﻘﻟﺍ ﻡﺎﺧ ﻦﻋ ﺚﺤﺑﺍ

ﺮﻴﻀﺤﺘﻠﻟ ﺎﺘﻗﻭ ﻚﺤﻨﻤﻳ ﺎﻤﻣ ،ﺔﺷﺩﺭﺪﻟﺍ ﻕﻭﺪﻨﺻ ﺮﺒﻋ ﻚﻣﻼﻋﺇ ﻢﺘﻴﺳ ،ﺔﻴﻨﻣﺯ ﺔﻔﺻﺎﻋ ﺏﺍﺮﺘﻗﺍ ﺪﻨﻋ .ﻲﻨﻣﺰﻟﺍ ﺭﺍﺮﻘﺘﺳﻻﺍ ﺽﺎﻔﺨﻧﺍ ﺮﻴﺛﺄﺗ ﺲﻔﻧ ﺎﻬﻟ ﻲﺘﻟﺍ ،ﺢﻄﺴﻟﺍ ﻰﻠﻋ ﺔﻴﻨﻣﺯ ﻒﺻﺍﻮﻋ ﻪﺟﺍﻮﺘﺳ ﺎﻧﺎﻴﺣﺃ .ﺭﺍﺮﻘﺘﺳﻼﻟ ﺮﺧﺁ ﻥﺎﻜﻣ ﻦﻋ ﺚﺤﺒﻟﺍ ﻲﻓ ﺐﻏﺮﺗ ﺪﻗ ،ﺢﻄﺴﻟﺍ ﻰﻠﻋ ﺖﻧﺃﻭ ﻊﺟﺍﺮﺘﻳ ﻲﻨﻣﺰﻟﺍ ﻙﺭﺍﺮﻘﺘﺳﺍ ﻥﺎﻛ ﺍﺫﺇ .ﺎﻴﻨﻣﺯ ﺓﺮﻘﺘﺴﻣ ﺮﻴﻏ ﻥﻮﻜﺗ ،ﺽﺭﻷﺍ ﻕﺎﻤﻋﺃ ﻲﻓ ﺔﺻﺎﺧ ،ﻖﻃﺎﻨﻤﻟﺍ ﺾﻌﺑ .ﺓﺮﻤﺘﺴﻣ ﺭﺍﺮﺿﻷ ﻙﺪﺴﺟ ﺽﺮﻌﺘﻴﺳﻭ ﻻﺎﻤﺘﺣﺍ ﺮﺜﻛﺃ ﺀﺎﻳﻮﻗﻷﺍ ﺀﺍﺪﻋﻷﺍ ﺭﻮﻬﻇ ﻥﻮﻜﻳ ﺚﻴﺣ ،ﺃﺪﺼﻟﺍ ﻢﻟﺎﻋ ﻞﺧﺪﺘﺳ ،ﺮﻔﺼﻟﺍ ﻰﻟﺇ ﻲﻨﻣﺰﻟﺍ ﻙﺭﺍﺮﻘﺘﺳﺍ ﻞﺻﻭ ﺍﺫﺇ .ﺔﻋﺎﺴﻟﺍ ﺏﺭﺎﻘﻋ ﻩﺎﺠﺗﺍ ﺲﻜﻋ ﺱﺮﺘﻟﺍ ﻥﺍﺭﻭﺪﺑ ﺮﻬﻈﻳ ﺎﻤﻣ ،ﻲﻨﻣﺰﻟﺍ ﻙﺭﺍﺮﻘﺘﺳﺍ ﻑﺰﻨﺘﺴﻴﺳ ﺾﻔﺨﻨﻣ ﺭﺍﺮﻘﺘﺳﺍ ﺕﺍﺫ ﻖﻃﺎﻨﻣ ﻲﻓ ﺀﺎﻘﺒﻟﺍ .ﻲﻨﻣﺰﻟﺍ ﻙﺭﺍﺮﻘﺘﺳﺍ ﺩﺍﺪﻋ ﻮﻫ ﻉﻮﺠﻟﺍﻭ ﺔﺤﺼﻟﺍ ﻂﻳﺮﺷ ﻦﻴﺑ (ﻕﺭﺯﻷﺍ) ﻥﺎﻴﺴﻟﺍ ﺱﺮﺘﻟﺍ.

.ﺎﻬﻠﻔﺳﺃ ﺔﻟﻮﺤﺘﻣ ﻭﺃ ﺔﻴﺑﻮﺳﺭ ﺕﺎﻘﺒﻃ ﺪﺟﻮﺗ ﻻ ﻪﻧﺃ ﻲﻨﻌﻳ ﺍﺬﻬﻓ ،(ﺖﻟﺯﺎﺒﻟﺍ ﺀﺎﻨﺜﺘﺳﺎﺑ) ﺔﻳﺭﺎﻧ ﺎﻣ ﺔﻘﻄﻨﻣ ﻲﻓ ﺮﺠﺤﻟﺍ ﻦﻣ ﺔﻳﻮﻠﻌﻟﺍ ﺔﻘﺒﻄﻟﺍ ﺖﻧﺎﻛ ﺍﺫﺇ .(ﻯﺮﺧﺃ ﺔﻳﺮﺨﺻ ﺔﻘﺒﻃ ﻱﺃ ﻕﻮﻓ ﺙﺪﺤﻳ ﻥﺃ ﻦﻜﻤﻳﻭ ﺀﺎﻨﺜﺘﺳﺍ ﺮﺒﺘﻌﻳ ﻱﺬﻟﺍ ،ﺖﻟﺯﺎﺒﻟﺍ ﺀﺎﻨﺜﺘﺳﺎﺑ) ﺔﻟﻮﺤﺘﻤﻟﺍﻭ ﺔﻴﺑﻮﺳﺮﻟﺍ ﺭﻮﺨﺼﻟﺍ ﺕﺎﻘﺒﻃ ﻞﻔﺳﺃ ﺙﺪﺤﺗ ﺎﻤﺋﺍﺩ ﺔﻳﺭﺎﻨﻟﺍ ﺭﻮﺨﺼﻟﺍ ﺕﺎﻘﺒﻃ .ﺖﻟﺯﺎﺒﻟﺍﻭ ،ﺖﻴﺗﻭﺪﻳﺮﺒﻟﺍ ،ﺖﻴﻧﺍﺮﺠﻟﺍ ،ﺖﻳﺰﻳﺪﻧﻷﺍ ﻞﻤﺸﺗ ﺔﻳﺭﺎﻨﻟﺍ ﺭﻮﺨﺼﻟﺍ

.ﺔﻳﺭﺎﻨﻟﺍ ﺭﻮﺨﺼﻟﺍ ﺕﺎﻘﺒﻃ ﻕﻮﻓ ﻦﻜﻟﻭ ،ﺔﻴﺑﻮﺳﺮﻟﺍ ﺭﻮﺨﺼﻟﺍ ﺕﺎﻘﺒﻃ ﻞﻔﺳﺃ ﺎﻤﺋﺍﺩ ﺙﺪﺤﺗ ﺔﻟﻮﺤﺘﻤﻟﺍ ﺭﻮﺨﺼﻟﺍ ﺕﺎﻘﺒﻃ .ﺖﺴﺸﻟﺍ ﻭﺃ ﺖﻳﻼﻠﻔﻟﺍ ﻞﺧﺍﺩ ﺐﺳﺍﻭﺮﻛ ﻂﻘﻓ ﺙﺪﺤﻳ ﻡﺎﺧﺮﻟﺍ ﻥﺈﻓ ،ﻚﻟﺫ ﻊﻣﻭ .ﻡﺎﺧﺮﻟﺍ ﻚﻟﺬﻛﻭ ،ﺖﺴﺸﻟﺍﻭ ﺖﻳﻼﻠﻔﻟﺍ ﻞﻤﺸﺗ ﺔﻟﻮﺤﺘﻤﻟﺍ ﺭﻮﺨﺼﻟﺍ

.ﻖﻤﻋﺃ ﻒﺸﻜﺘﺳﺍﻭ ﻒﻬﻛ ﻦﻋ ﺚﺤﺑﺍ ﺎﻤﺑﺭ - ﺎﻬﻠﻔﺳﺃ ﺔﻔﻠﺘﺨﻣ ﺔﻴﺑﻮﺳﺭ ﺕﺎﻘﺒﻃ ﻙﺎﻨﻫ ﻥﻮﻜﺗ ﻥﺃ ﻦﻜﻤﻤﻟﺍ ﻦﻤﻓ ،ﺔﻴﺑﻮﺳﺭ ﻉﻮﻧ ﻦﻣ ﺎﻴﻠﻌﻟﺍ ﺔﻘﺒﻄﻟﺍ ﺖﻧﺎﻛ ﺍﺫﺇ ،ﻚﻟﺫ ﻊﻣﻭ .ﺎﻬﺘﺤﺗ ﺔﻴﺑﻮﺳﺭ ﺕﺎﻘﺒﻃ ﻙﺎﻨﻫ ﻥﻮﻜﺗ ﻦﻟ - ﺮﺧﺁ ﻥﺎﻜﻣ ﻲﻓ ﺚﺤﺑﺎﻓ ،ﺔﻟﻮﺤﺘﻣ ﻭﺃ ﺔﻳﺭﺎﻧ ﺎﻣ ﺔﻘﻄﻨﻣ ﻲﻓ ﺮﺠﺤﻟﺍ ﻦﻣ ﺎﻴﻠﻌﻟﺍ ﺔﻘﺒﻄﻟﺍ ﺖﻳﺃﺭﻭ ،ﺮﻴﺷﺎﺒﻄﻟﺍ ﻭﺃ ﻱﺮﻴﺠﻟﺍ ﺮﺠﺤﻟﺍ ﻦﻋ ﺚﺤﺒﺗ ﺖﻨﻛ ﺍﺫﺇ ،ﻝﺎﺜﻤﻟﺍ ﻞﻴﺒﺳ ﻰﻠﻋ .(ﺀﺎﻨﺜﺘﺳﺍ ﺮﺒﺘﻌﻳ ﻱﺬﻟﺍ ،ﺖﻟﺯﺎﺒﻟﺍ ﺀﺎﻨﺜﺘﺳﺎﺑ) ﺔﻟﻮﺤﺘﻤﻟﺍﻭ ﺔﻳﺭﺎﻨﻟﺍ ﺭﻮﺨﺼﻟﺍ ﺕﺎﻘﺒﻃ ﻕﻮﻓ ﺎﻤﺋﺍﺩ ﺙﺪﺤﺗ ﺔﻴﺑﻮﺳﺮﻟﺍ ﺭﻮﺨﺼﻟﺍ ﺕﺎﻘﺒﻃ

ﻑﺎﺸﻜﺘﺳﻻﺍ ﻝﻼﺧ ﻦﻣ ﻲﻔﻜﻳ ﺎﻣ ﺪﺠﺗ ﻦﻜﺗ ﻢﻟ ﺍﺫﺇ ،ﺔﺒﻌﻠﻟﺍ ﺔﻳﺍﺪﺑ ﻲﻓ ﺔﻴﺳﺎﺤﻧ ﻊﻄﻗ ﻰﻠﻋ ﻝﻮﺼﺤﻠﻟ ﺓﺪﻴﻔﻣ ﺔﻘﻳﺮﻃ ﻪﻧﺇ .ﻯﺮﺧﺃ ﺮﺻﺎﻨﻋ ﻰﻟﺇ ﺔﻓﺎﺿﻹﺎﺑ ،ﺔﻳﺪﻘﻨﻟﺍ ﻊﻄﻘﻟﺍ ﻦﻣ ﻯﺮﺧﺃ ﻉﺍﻮﻧﺃ ﺾﻌﺑﻭ ﺱﺎﺤﻨﻟﺍ ﻦﻣ ﺓﺮﻴﻐﺻ ﺕﺎﻴﻤﻛ ﻰﻠﻋ ﻝﻮﺼﺤﻟﺎﺑ ﺐﻋﻼﻟ ﺢﻤﺴﻳ ﺐﻴﻘﻨﺘﻟﺍ.

ﻮﻫ ﺐﻴﻘﻨﺘﻠﻟ ﺐﻋﻼﻟﺍ ﻪﺟﺎﺘﺤﻳ ﺎﻣ ﻞﻛ ﺔﻴﺒﺸﺧ ﺓﻼﻘﻣ، ﻭ ،ﻪﻴﻓ ﻑﻮﻗﻮﻠﻟ ﺀﺎﻣeither ﻞﻣﺭ، ﻰﺼﺣ، ﻭﺃ ﺔﻴﻤﻈﻋ ﺔﺑﺮﺗ (ﻦﻤﻳﻷﺍ ﺓﺭﺄﻔﻟﺍ ﺭﺰﺑ ﻂﻐﺿﺍ ،ﺀﺎﻤﻟﺍ ﻲﻓ ﻑﻮﻗﻮﻟﺍ ﺔﻃﺎﺴﺒﺑ .(ﻞﻤﻌﺗ ﻦﻟ ﺔﻠﺣﻮﻤﻟﺍ ﻰﺼﺤﻟﺍ (rightmouse) ﺓﻼﻘﻤﻠﻟ 'ﺕﺎﻨﺤﺷ' ﺔﻴﻧﺎﻤﺛ ﻰﻠﻋ ﻱﻮﺘﺤﺗ ﺓﺩﺎﻤﻟﺍ ﻦﻣ ﺔﻠﺘﻛ ﻞﻛ .ﺔﻠﺑﺮﻐﻟﺍ ﺀﺪﺒﻟ ﻦﻤﻳﻷﺍ ﺓﺭﺄﻔﻟﺍ ﺭﺰﺑ ﻯﺮﺧﺃ ﺓﺮﻣ ﻂﻐﺿﺍ ﻢﺛ ،ﺎﻬﺘﻠﺑﺮﻏ ﺩﺍﺮﻤﻟﺍ ﺓﺩﺎﻤﻟﺍ ﻰﻠﻋ.

ﻰﺼﺤﻟﺍﻭ ﻞﻣﺮﻟﺎﺑ ﺔﻧﺭﺎﻘﻣ ﺞﺋﺎﺘﻨﻟﺍ ﻦﻣ ﺎﻣﺎﻤﺗ ﺔﻔﻠﺘﺨﻣ ﺔﻋﻮﻤﺠﻣ ﺞﺘﻨﺘﺳ ﺔﻴﻤﻈﻌﻟﺍ ﺔﺑﺮﺘﻟﺍ ﻥﺈﻓ ،ﻚﻟﺫ ﻊﻣﻭ .ﺞﺋﺎﺘﻨﻟﺍ ﺲﻔﻧ ﺞﺘﻨﻳ ﻰﺼﺤﻟﺍﻭ ﻞﻣﺮﻟﺍ .ﺎﻬﻨﻣ ﺎﻬﻴﻠﻋ ﻞﺼﺤﺗ ﻲﺘﻟﺍ ﺭﺎﺠﺣﻷﺍ ﻑﻼﺨﺑ ،ﺞﺋﺎﺘﻨﻟﺍ ﻰﻠﻋ ﺮﺛﺆﻳ ﻻ ﻰﺼﺤﻟﺍﻭ ﻞﻣﺮﻟﺍ ﻲﻓ ﺮﺠﺤﻟﺍ ﻉﻮﻧ.

ﺝﺎﺘﺤﻳ ،ﻪﻧﻮﻟ ﻰﻠﻋ ﻅﺎﻔﺤﻠﻟ ﺵﺎﻤﻘﻟﺍ ﺔﻔﻠﺘﺨﻣ ﺩﺍﻮﻣ ﻦﻣ ﺖﻴﺒﺜﺘﻟﺍ ﺩﺍﻮﻣ ﻊﻨﺻ ﻦﻜﻤﻳ .ﻪﻐﺒﺻ ﻞﺒﻗ ﺖﻴﺒﺜﺘﻟﺍ ﺓﺩﺎﻣ ﻰﻤﺴﻳ ﻲﺋﺎﻴﻤﻴﻛ ﻝﻮﻠﺤﻣ ﻲﻓ ﺔﺠﻟﺎﻌﻣ ﻰﻟﺇ (ﺩﺍﻮﻣ). ﻡﺍﺪﺨﺘﺳﺎﺑ ﺎﻬﻘﺤﺳ ﻰﻟﺇ ﺝﺎﺘﺤﺘﺳ ،(ﺓﺭﺎﺠﺘﻟﺍ ﻭﺃ ﺐﻴﻘﻨﺘﻟﺍ ﻝﻼﺧ ﻦﻣ) ﺎﻬﻟ ﺓﺪﻴﺟ ﺓﺩﺎﻣ ﺪﺠﺗ ﻥﺃ ﺩﺮﺠﻤﺑ ﻖﺣﺎﺳ ﻰﻟﺇ ﺎﻬﺘﻓﺎﺿﺇﻭ ﻞﻴﻣﺮﺑ ﺕﺎﻋﺎﺳ ﻊﻀﺒﻟ ﻪﻗﻼﻏﺇﻭ ﻞﻴﻣﺮﺒﻟﺍ ﻰﻟﺇ ﺵﺎﻤﻘﻟﺍ ﺔﻓﺎﺿﻹ ﺍﺰﻫﺎﺟ ﻥﻮﻜﺗ ﻢﺛ .ﺀﺎﻤﻟﺍ ﻦﻣ.

ﻊﻨﺻ ﻦﻜﻤﻳ ﻍﺎﺒﺻﻷﺍ ﻒﺿﺃ ،ﺍﺰﻫﺎﺟ ﺔﻐﺒﺼﻟﺍ ﻞﻴﻣﺮﺑ ﻥﻮﻜﻳ ﻥﺃ ﺩﺮﺠﻤﺑ .ﺎﻫﺮﻴﻏ ﻦﻣ ﺔﻐﺒﺼﻟﺍ ﻦﻣ ﺪﻳﺰﻤﻟﺍ ﻍﺎﺒﺻﻷﺍ ﺾﻌﺑ ﺐﻠﻄﺘﺗ .ﺔﻐﺒﺻ ﻊﻨﺼﻟ ﺀﺎﻤﻟﺍ ﻦﻣ ﻞﻴﻣﺮﺑ ﻰﻟﺇ ﺎﻬﺘﻓﺎﺿﺇ ﻚﻨﻜﻤﻳ ،ﺎﻬﻨﻋ ﺚﺤﺒﺗ ﻲﺘﻟﺍ ﺔﻐﺒﺼﻟﺍ ﺪﺠﺗ ﻥﺃ ﺩﺮﺠﻤﺑ .ﺎﻫﺮﻴﻏ ﻦﻣ ﻪﻴﻠﻋ ﺭﻮﺜﻌﻟﺍ ﻲﻓ ﻞﻬﺳﺃ ﻥﻮﻜﻴﺳ ﺎﻬﻀﻌﺑ .ﺔﻔﻠﺘﺨﻤﻟﺍ ﻥﺩﺎﻌﻤﻟﺍﻭ ﺕﺎﺗﺎﺒﻨﻟﺍ ﻦﻣ ﺪﻳﺪﻌﻟﺍ ﻦﻣ ﺖﻴﺒﺜﺘﻟﺍ ﺩﺍﻮﻤﺑ ﺞﻟﺎﻌﻤﻟﺍ ﺵﺎﻤﻘﻟﺍ ﺎﻬﺘﻋﺎﻨﺼﻟ ﺎﻓﺮﺘﺤﻣ ﺎﻌﻧﺎﺻ ﺔﻘﻴﻗﺮﻟﺍ ﺲﺑﻼﻤﻟﺍ ﻦﻣ ﺪﻳﺪﻌﻟﺍ ﺐﻠﻄﺘﺗ :ﺔﻈﺣﻼﻣ) ﺲﺑﻼﻤﻟﺍ ﻊﻨﺼﻟ ﻥﻮﻠﻣﻭ ﻕﺮﺸﻣ ﺵﺎﻤﻗ ﻰﻠﻋ ﻞﺼﺤﺘﺳﻭ ،ﺓﺮﺘﻔﻟ ﻪﻘﻠﻏﺃﻭ ﻪﻴﻟﺇ).

ﺀﺎﻨﺑ ﺐﻠﻄﺘﻳ ﻲﻋﺍﺮﺷ ﺏﺭﺎﻗ ﻡﺍﺪﺨﺘﺳﺎﺑ ﺔﻃﺎﺴﺒﺑ ﺃﺪﺒﻳ ﺀﻲﺷ ﻞﻛ ﻦﻜﻟ .ﺕﺍﻮﻄﺨﻟﺍ ﻦﻣ ﺪﻳﺪﻌﻟﺍﻭ ﺩﺍﻮﻤﻟﺍ ﻦﻣ ﺓﺮﻴﺒﻛ ﺔﻴﻤﻛ ﺕﺍﺮﻜﺑ. ﺡﺎﺘﻔﻣ ﻡﺍﺪﺨﺘﺳﺎﺑ ﻂﻄﺨﻤﻟﺍ ﻩﺎﺠﺗﺍ ﺮﻴﻴﻐﺗ ﻚﻨﻜﻤﻳ .ﺔﺒﻌﻠﻟﺍ ﻞﺧﺍﺩ ﻂﻄﺨﻣ ﺮﻬﻈﻴﺳ :ﻊﻳﺮﺴﻟﺍ ﻚﺗﺍﻭﺩﺃ ﻂﻳﺮﺷ ﻲﻓ ﺎﻬﻌﻗﻮﻣ ﺩﺪﺣﻭ ﺕﺍﺮﻜﺑ ﺲﻤﺧ ﻊﻨﺻﺍ toolmodeselect. ﺀﺎﻤﻟﺍ ﻲﻓ ﺩﻮﺟﻮﻣ ﻂﻄﺨﻤﻠﻟ ﻕﺭﺯﻷﺍ ﻥﻮﻠﻟﺎﺑ ﺰﻴﻤﻤﻟﺍ ﻂﻳﺮﺸﻟﺍ ﻥﺃ ﻦﻣ ﺪﻛﺄﺘﻟﺍ ﻊﻣ) ﺔﻳﻮﺘﺴﻣ ﺔﻘﻄﻨﻣ ﻰﻠﻋ ﺕﺍﺮﻜﺒﻟﺍ ﻊﺿ).

handbook-pitkiln-createdby:
Place clay products in a 1x1x1 hole, then place dry grass, sticks and firewood. Peat and coal can also be used instead of firewood. Ignite to fire your clay products. Careful, ignites nearby combustible blocks.

A pit kiln fueled with firewood will take 20 hours to finish. Peat will take 16 hours, brown/black coal 12 hours, and charcoal 10 hours.

item-handbooktext-boat-sailed-*:
Sailboats are constructed in place on land, and then rolled into the water. They cannot be picked up. They can be deconstructed by right clicking with a saw. See the Building A Sailboat entry for more information.

Movement
Once you have constructed your sailboat, click on the starboard seat by the tiller at the back to sit in it, then you can use normal navigation keys to move the boat. The sailboat currently does not respond to wind direction, only your movement keys. The sail will automatically unfurl when you sit by the tiller, and furl when you leave the boat.

Equipping
The boat can also hold several passengers - one can sit directly to port of the tiller adjacent to the spot you sit to steer the boat. Additional seats can be added to each of the eight cargo hold spots as well.

You can place containers (including chests, baskets, and storage vessels) in the hold of the boat, and access them on or off the boat.

You can also place a mount (such as an elk) on the boat by first placing a wooden fence post in one of the cargo spots - being sure to leave 2 cargo spots empty aft of the post - and then using a rope on this fence post, which will place the animal into the aft cargo spots. You can then disembark the animal using rightmouse on the fence post.

You can attach a lantern to the aft face of the mast (about 3 meters up) to provide light.

Ratlines can be attached to the gunwhales on each side of the mast in order to allow you to climb to the top of the mast to look around.

An anchor can be placed in the front-left space in the prow (though currently the anchor has no function).

There is also a spot at the prow for a chiseled figurehead to be placed (in the future - currently not supported).
item-handbooktext-boat-raft-*:
- Place the raft with a rightmouse click.
- rightmouse click on the raft to board it.
- With an oar in your active hotbar slot, you can move the raft.

- Pick up the raft using the shift button combined with a rightmouse click.

tutorial-firststeps-1: Use {0} {1} {2} {3} keys to move around. Use your mouse to look around. Use {4} to jump and {5} to sneak. Hold {6} and {0} to sprint.
tutorial-firststeps-2:
Hold {0} to release your mouse cursor. With this you can mouse-over and click on links, including the links and images in this tutorial.
Click here to continue
tutorial-firststeps-3:
(Press <hk>chatdialog</hk> to close the chat window!)

Now use {0} to open your inventory and {1} to see your Character inventory. You can use the <hk>escapemenudialog</hk> key to close inventories
tutorial-firststeps-4: Find {0} <itemstack type="item">flint|stone-chert|stone-granite|stone-peridotite|stone-andesite|stone-basalt|stone-obsidian</itemstack> knappable stones found loosely on the ground. Collect them using <icon>rightmousebutton</icon> or <icon>leftmousebutton</icon>
tutorial-firststeps-5: Nice! Now find {0} <itemstack type="item">stick</itemstack> sticks, found on the ground in forests or when breaking leaves with branches inside.
tutorial-firststeps-6: You're a natural! Use 2 stones to create a knifeblade-flint|knifeblade-chert|knifeblade-granite|knifeblade-peridotite|knifeblade-andesite|knifeblade-basalt|knifeblade-obsidian knife blade with the knapping system. shift + rightmousebutton on the ground with a knappable stone in hands to begin. Then shift + rightmousebutton again with the second stone, choose the Knife blade shape, and tap it out!
tutorial-firststeps-7: The knife blade still needs a handle. Open your inventory (with inventorydialog), to craft a knife-generic-flint|knife-generic-chert|knife-generic-granite|knife-generic-peridotite|knife-generic-andesite|knife-generic-basalt|knife-generic-obsidian knife in your 3x3 crafting grid. Click that link or use the handbook (open with handbook) to look up the recipe.
tutorial-firststeps-8: Welcome to the Stone Age! With your knife in hands, hold <icon>leftmousebutton</icon> to harvest {0} <itemstack type="item">papyrustops|cattailtops</itemstack> from <itemstack type="block">tallplant-coopersreed-land-normal-free|tallplant-papyrus-land-normal-free</itemstack> cattails or papyrus
tutorial-firststeps-9: Storage time! Using 10 cattails or papyrus, craft a basket basket. To equip the basket, place it in one of the 4 special slots on the right of your inventory (inventorydialog). Ultimately you'll probably want to have 4 of them.
tutorial-firststeps-10: Don't forget about food! Collect {0} berries, mushrooms, wild crops or other edibles. Harvest berries with <icon>rightmousebutton</icon>
tutorial-firststeps-11: You'll need an axe! Use 2 knappable stones to make an axe head, then craft an axe from the axe head combined with a stick.
tutorial-firststeps-12: With your axe in hands, chop down a small tree by holding <icon>leftmousebutton</icon>. Chop the base of the tree and eventually the whole tree will fall. Collect {0} logs.
tutorial-firststeps-13: Way to go, you lumberjack! Let's turn that into firewood. Use the logs and axe to craft {0} firewood firewood in your inventory.
tutorial-firststeps-14: We also need tinder. With your knife in hands, cut some grass to collect {0} drygrass dry grass.
tutorial-firststeps-15: Time to invent fire! With the dry grass in your hands, hold <hk>shift</hk> + <icon>rightmousebutton</icon> while aiming at the ground to place it down as tinder for your firepit.
tutorial-firststeps-16: With <icon>rightmousebutton</icon> lay down 4 firewood on top of the tinder to make a complete firepit.
tutorial-firststeps-18: With the firestarter firestarter in hands, hold shift + rightmousebutton while aiming at the firepit to ignite it. It might take a couple of tries...
tutorial-firststeps-19:
You have discovered fire! \o/
Use a firepit to create torches and to roast meat or cattail roots, or to make meals. Craft a torch-basic-extinct-up torch next.
tutorial-firststeps-20: <icon>rightmousebutton</icon> on the firepit, place the torch into the left-hand slot of the firepit and give it a few seconds (it needs to reach 300 degrees). Pick up the <itemstack type="block">torch-basic-lit-up</itemstack> lit torch from your firepit.
tutorial-firststeps-21: Congratulations! Now you know the basics of Vintage Story. This starter tutorial is concluded. For your next steps, check out the Starter Guide and Progression Guide. To remove this message, use rightmousebutton to place your torch on a nearby wall or on the ground!

worldattribute-landformScale-desc:
Landforms are the principal mechanic that shape the terrain. They are what determine where are lakes, mountains, hills, flat lands, cliffs,... how common they are, and (optionally) in what climate they can occur.
An increased landform scale means the same landform will occupy a larger area. In other words, you will encounter wider mountains, wider lakes, wider flat lands, etc.
setting-accessibility-notes: For the full experience we recommend leaving these settings unchanged, unless they cause discomfort to you.
setting-hover-camerashake: Adjust camera shake strength for various effects such as freezing, getting hurt, after teleporting and other sources
setting-hover-wireframethickness: Determines the thickness of the block selection box and the gridlines when knapping, clayforming, smithing or chiseling
setting-hover-wireframecolors: Determines the colors for the wireframe gridlines when knapping, clayforming, or smithing. Preset 2 or Preset 3 can improve color contrast for various types of colorblindness or color vision anomaly.
setting-hover-instabilityWavingStrength: Determines the intensity of the waviness during low temporal stability situations

blockdesc-meta-filler: Can be placed as part of a structure, to force air blocks during schematic import, such as worldgen
blockdesc-meta-pathway: Can be placed as part of a structure, to require a path between a cave entrance and the structure
blockdesc-meta-underground: Can be placed as part of a structure, to test for solid block is at this location
blockdesc-meta-aboveground: Can be placed as part of a structure (surface ruin), to test if a location is above terrain
blockdesc-meta-collider: Can be used for invisible collisions, and as part of chiseled blocks
blockdesc-meta-selectablecollider: Can be used for invisible collisions, and as part of chiseled blocks. Remains selectable by the player.

blockdesc-meta-blocklayer: Can be added to chiseled blocks - worldgen will replace it with the block layer at the placed location, should it spawn below surface
item-handbooktext-creature-goat-ibexnub-: Nubian Ibex are an equatorial goat, that prefers hot and dry climates, with little to no forest cover.  They also prefer lower elevations than most other goats.
item-handbooktext-creature-goat-valais-*: Valais goats are a temperate climate goat.  They dislike excessively rainy areas, and areas of heavy forest. But unlike most goats, they are more comfortable at less extreme elevations.
item-handbooktext-creature-goat-takingol: Related to goats, golden takin prefer moderately high mountains and badlands. They dislike forests, but do not mind wet climates, unlike most goats.
item-handbooktext-creature-goat-turdag-*: Tur are a type of goat that prefers moderate to high mountains. They dislike forests, but do not mind wet climates, unlike most other goats.
item-handbooktext-creature-goat-muskox-*: Musk oxen are more closely related to goats and sheep than cattle (despite their name).  They are found in arctic regions, and unlike most goats can be found at low elevations.  They dislike regions of high precipitation, or extremely heavy forest.
item-handbooktext-creature-goat-nubian-*: Nubian goats are a tropical climate goat that can be found at low elevations, unlike most goats. They like dry climates, with low amounts of forest cover.
item-handbooktext-creature-goat-sirohi-*: Sirohi goats are a tropical climate goat that can be found at low elevations, unlike most goats. They are more tolerant of rain than their Nubian cousins, but still do not like extremely high levels of rain. Like most goats, they dislike heavy forest cover.
item-handbooktext-creature-goat-*: Goats are typically found in rough terrain, well above sea level. In general, they avoid overly rainy climates, and forests.
setting-hover-togglesprint: Additionally allows double tab forward to activate sprint
worldattribute-caveIns-desc: Causes unstable rock to collapse when mined

block-handbooktext-daub-*: Wattle and daub is made by applying raw daub to a placed wattle fence block. After the initial ten daub to create the block, you can apply up to two more raw daub to create a totally smooth wattle and daub block.
block-handbooktext-wattle-*: Apply raw daub to a wattle fence section, to turn it into a block of wattle and daub.
item-handbooktext-daubraw-*: Raw daub must be applied to a placed wattle fence block, to create a block of wattle and daub.

itemdesc-hoovedwearables-head-bridle1: Useful for precise, short distance travel
item-handbooktext-hoovedwearables-head-b: When your mount is wearing a curb bit, you need only press forward once, rather than hold it down, to move.
itemdesc-hoovedwearables-face-face*: Place on the brow of a tamed elk to claim ownership. You can only claim one elk at a time.
item-handbooktext-acid-full-sulfuric: Sulfuric acid is produced by cooking (in a cooking pot) two portions of powdered sulfur with one portion of saltpeter, and one portion of water.
item-handbooktext-sulfate-full-chromite: Chromium sulfate is produced by cooking (in a cooking pot) two portions of crushed chromite with two portions of sulfuric acid.
itemdesc-ratlines: Apply to a sailboat, to be able to climb to the top of the mast
item-handbooktext-anchor-stone: The stone anchor can be placed in the front-left prow location of the sailboat (and only this spot). The anchor is currently the only thing able to be placed in this spot, however it currently has no use.
itemdesc-instrument-flute1: Allows you to call mounts to you that you have claimed ownership over. Use the medallion to claim ownership on Elks. You can only own one Elk.
item-handbooktext-roller: Roller logs are placed on the ground, in preparation to begin construction of a boat keel. Pay attention to the placement preview, and make sure the blue higlight cubes are in water. Use the toolmodeselect key to change the orientation of the preview blocks.
blockdesc-claybricks-clinkerrough: Uses even the most warped bricks, for a more efficient, but less neat, result.

storygenfailed-text:
With this update, the game automatically attempted to add the new story chapters to your world. Unfortunately, this process failed because at least one of the locations that should have been generated was blocked by player-built structure.

If you want to experience the full story you will need to manually designate a suitable location for the missing ones to spawn.

1. Preparation: Switch to Creative Mode using /gamemode creative. Enable No Clip and Fly mode by pressing F3 multiple times.

2. Choose an area that meets these criteria:
Appropriate travel distance as you wish.
Free from player-built structures within a specific range.

To check the required range for a story location, use a command like: /wgen story setpos locationname s[].
Replace locationname with the name of the location you want to add from the list at the very end of this dialog.
This command will test your current location and return the required clearance distance for the story location.
Verify that the required space (as determined by the command) does not overlap with any player-built structures.

Now position your player where the center of the new story location will be. This area will then be replaced and regenerated with the story structure and terrain.

3. Set the Story Location: Use the following command to save the chosen location to your current position: /wgen story setpos locationname s[] true Note: This command saves the location but does not regenerate chunks immediately.

4. Generate New Chunks: Based on the output of the previous command, you’ll be told how far to delete the existing chunks. Run a command like /wgen delr 1 to delete the specified chunks and allow for regeneration.

Note: One chunk is by default 32 blocks.

You can reopen this dialog at any time using: /wgen story listmissing

Missing story locations:
